com.kderyabin.services

Interface NavigateServiceInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NavigateService

    public interface NavigateServiceInterface
    Application navigation service allows navigation between different "screens" by loading asynchronously requested view into the content display area. A term screen is used because the application does not provide navigation between scenes or stages. It simply loads requested view into the display area. NavigateService allows also to reload a menu bar which actually goes beyond the purpose of this class. It's done to keep the navigation logic in one place. Important note, to load some view you must first register it for navigation using NavigationService.register() method.

      • register

        void register(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.Class<? extends de.saxsys.mvvmfx.FxmlView<? extends de.saxsys.mvvmfx.ViewModel>> clazz)
        Registers view classes for the navigation.
        Parameters:
        name - Some name to associate with the View.
        clazz - View class, something like MainView.class.

      • navigate

        void navigate(java.lang.String viewName)
        Method used to navigate between pages. It loads a new view and resets components of the content area.
        Parameters:
        viewName - See loadContent.
